title: Bumi Resources Minerals says Palu operations unaffected by site closure
summary: The publicly listed miner, while confirming the closure of a site within subsidiary CPM's forest concession over illegal land clearing, has underlined that the targeted area was not operational and so will not affect its overall operations.

title: New state miner Perminas signs MoU on Gabon rare earth project
summary: PT Perusahaan Mineral Nasional and Danantara may also enter negotiations for equity or debt participation in the Maboumine project, according to a statement, though no value or timeline has been disclosed.

title: As Global Attention Turns to the US: What Are Its Businesses Doing In Indonesia?
summary: With much of the global conversation currently focused on developments in and around the United States, attention often gravitates toward politics, policy shifts and geopolitical implications. Less visible, but equally important, is how US businesses continue to operate and invest overseas amid this evolving global context.

title: Coal must go for climate funds to flow, German ambassador says
summary: Private funds could flow elsewhere without coal cuts, the German ambassador to Indonesia warns, saying renewables cannot scale while coal remains dominant.

title: Trump says Japan to invest in energy, industrial projects in Ohio, Texas and Georgia
summary: United States President Donald Trump's administration on Tuesday announced three projects valued at US$36 billion to be financed by Japan, including an oil export facility in Texas, an industrial diamonds plant in Georgia and a natural gas power plant in Ohio.

title: Govt urged not to compromise too much for US trade deal
summary: The government has issued a loosely-worded statement days ahead of the expected signing of a tariff agreement with the United States, following a weekend meeting at President Prabowo Subianto’s Hambalang estate in Bogor, West Java.

title: Unlocking regional potential to boost economic growth
summary: As an archipelagic country, Indonesia is endowed with diverse economic potential across regions, reflected in regional economic structures and export profiles.

title: Job threats, rogue bots: five hot issues in AI
summary: As artificial intelligence evolves at a blistering pace, world leaders and thousands of other delegates will discuss how to handle the technology at the AI Impact Summit, which opens Monday in New Delhi.

title: Dollar holds gains in thin trading as markets await Fed minutes, US GDP
summary: The dollar held gains on Tuesday as markets awaited signals, expected later this week, about the potential timing of rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

title: Idle oil and gas projects risk losing licenses, Bahlil warns
summary: The energy minister has taken an "all stick, no carrot" strategy to pressure firms into start pumping oil and gas from stalled projects, threatening hundreds of wells with the prospect of losing their permits.

title: Site selection for first nuclear plant expected by mid-2026, says renewables official
summary: According to the ministry's renewables director general, the Bangka Belitung Islands and West Kalimantan are two priority provinces under consideration as a potential site for developing Indonesia's first nuclear power plant toward a 2032 on-grid target.

title: Asian markets sluggish as Lunar New Year holiday looms
summary: Asian markets were subdued on Monday, as the extended Lunar New Year holiday approached and Japan reported lackluster economic growth.

title: Japan's economy limps back to scant growth in Q4, raises test for Takaichi
summary: Japan's economy limped back to meager growth in the fourth quarter, significantly missing market expectations in a key test for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's government as cost-of-living pressures drag on confidence and domestic demand.

title: Businesses seek AI regulatory clarity as caution hampers investment
summary: Some technology firms deliberately avoid using personally identifiable information in their AI models to reduce compliance risks, despite the limitations this places on their ability to improve operational efficiency.

title: Vietnam licenses Musk's satellite internet firm Starlink
summary: Vietnam has granted a license to Elon Musk's Starlink to operate its satellite internet services in the communist country, a government agency said.

title: China’s ByteDance releases Doubao 2.0 AI model for 'agent era'
summary: China's ByteDance has rolled out its Doubao 2.0 model, an upgrade of the country's most widely used artificial-intelligence app, the company said on Saturday.

title: EU proposes extending Russian oil sanctions to maritime services
summary: It has been reported that Karimun, Riau Islands, has been part of a system of traders, shippers and transshipment points, including the floating hub along the Malacca and Singapore straits and Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates, that has helped keep Russian oil and products flowing, despite the sanctions.

title: Lunar New Year drives corporate decor boom, but retail demand falters
summary: Sellers of nian gao or kue keranjang in Glodok’s Chinatown area as well as parts of West and Central Java reporting softer sales compared to previous years.

title: 'Be realistic' says Prabowo, while defending key programs
summary: President Prabowo Subianto has emphasized the need to be realistic in a speech on the Indonesian economy, where he promoted key initiatives of his administration to drive gross domestic product growth.

title: Tiffany & Co stores sealed over alleged illegal imports
summary: The issue related to items that were not declared in the import notification, resulting in the sealing of the jeweler’s outlets in Plaza Senayan, Plaza Indonesia and Pacific Place.

title: High-rise housing still a hard sell in Jakarta, says JLL
summary: Cumulative sales in high-rise condos stood at just 56 percent last year in a continuation of a decade-long downward trend, while new launches remained subdued in a lackluster market.

title: EU leaders vow to accelerate single market, in struggle to compete with US, China
summary: European Union leaders agreed on Thursday on a wide-ranging set of commitments to improve how the bloc's border-free internal market works so Europe's businesses can be competitive and survive aggressive economic rivalry from the US and China.

title: Asian shares step back from record as tech jitters return, bonds rally
summary: Asian shares retreated from record highs on Friday as worries about shrinking margins in the tech sector hit the likes of Apple, driving investors into safe-haven bonds ahead of key US inflation data.

title: Danantara’s poultry push raises concerns over market distortion
summary: Indonesia has enjoyed a surplus in chicken meat production since 2020, Statistics Indonesia (BPS) data show, with excess supply continuing even after the free meals program began.

title: Pertamina to spin off airlines, hospitals, non-oil units this year
summary: Divested assets include hospital groups currently managed by Indonesia Healthcare Corporation (IHC), as well as aviation subsidiary Pelita Air, which is set to be merged with national flag carrier Garuda Indonesia.

title: Prabowo ordered purge of IDX, OJK leadership, brother says
summary: Hashim Djojohadikusumo, who is the special envoy for climate change and the brother of President Prabowo Subianto, said the five IDX and OJK officials who resigned soon after last month’s market crash did so in direct response to the President’s order.

title: Gold edges lower on firmer dollar after strong US jobs data
summary: Gold prices dipped on Thursday, as the U.S. dollar firmed after stronger-than-expected January jobs data dented expectation for near-term interest rate cuts, while investors awaited inflation data due on Friday for more monetary policy cues.

title: Danantara’s IDX ownership plan gets guarded welcome
summary: Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani pointed out that it is common practice for sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) to hold stakes in bourses, typically ranging from 15 percent to 30 percent.

title: Indonesia ready to bridge trade, investment in Islamic world
summary: According to "State of Global Islamic Economy Report 2024-2025", Indonesia is ranked third in the global Islamic economy, after Malaysia and Saudi Arabia.

title: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison shows healthy fundamentals in 2025 with 12.2% net profit growth
summary: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (ISAT) demonstrated robust performance throughout 2025, recording revenue of Rp 56.5 trillion (US$3.37 billion) in addition to double-digit profit growth of 12.2 percent year-on-year (yoy) and 51 percent quarter-on-quarter (qoq) to Rp 5.5 trillion.

title: PLN EPI breaks ground on Rp1 trillion gas pipeline
summary: PT PLN Energi Primer Indonesia has begun the construction of a Rp 1 trillion (US$59.57 million) gas pipeline linking the West Natuna Transportation System (WNTS) to Pemping Island, Batam.

title: SWA RoboKnights to represent Indonesia at VEX Robotics World Championship in the US
summary: In a masterclass of skill and strategy, Sinarmas World Academy’s SWA RoboKnights powered through the VEX Robotics Indonesia National Championship 2025/2026, earning six major awards and securing a coveted spot on the global stage.

title: Buoyant stocks pause for breath on signs of softening US consumption
summary: Bonds jumped and a rebound in stock markets slowed down on Wednesday after softer-than-expected US retail sales figures, while a rally in the yen has extended and might be beginning to signal a shift in investor thinking since Japan's election.

title: Pertamina denies Russian crude imports as EU mulls sanctions
summary: The European Union has proposed unprecedented sanctions against Indonesia’s Karimun Port for handling Russian oil.

title: Retail sales post strong annual gain as consumer confidence holds up
summary: The retail sales index dipped slightly in January when compared with the holiday month of December but is up a strong 7 percent year-on-year.

title: Finance Ministry’s SMI secures $9.3m grants to expand green finance
summary: PT SMI operates as a development finance institution providing corporate and public financing alongside project advisory and preparation services.

title: Indonesia’s growth: Resilient but uneven
summary: Although formal job creation has improved, job quality, reflected in income stability, benefits and productivity, remains unequal.

title: Fiscal discipline remains intact, govt insists, after Moody’s outlook cut
summary: State Secretary Prasetyo Hadi said on Monday that the government continued to adhere to fiscal rules and had not breached statutory deficit limits, stressing that budget management remained on a prudent footing.

title: Jury told that Meta, Google 'engineered addiction' at landmark US trial
summary: Meta and Google-owned YouTube were accused Monday of pushing highly addictive apps on children as a landmark social media trial began in earnest in a California court.

title: Bulog proposes Mecca warehouse to stock haj rice exports
summary: Bulog’s planned warehouse in the Haj Village will also be used to store other food commodities from Indonesia, such as meat and fish, to meet the consumption needs of the haj pilgrims.

title: EU proposes sanctions on Indonesian ports for handling Russian oil
summary: The proposal would bar EU companies and individuals from conducting transactions with Karimun Port in Indonesia and Kulevi Port in Georgia.

title: FTSE Russell postpones Indonesia index review
summary: About US$120 billion has been wiped from the benchmark Jakarta Composite after larger rival MSCI warned last month the country risked a downgrade to frontier status.

title: Poverty at record low as govt seeks to redefine threshold
summary: The poverty rate rests at a historic low of 8.25 percent of the total population, continuing its declining trend from September 2022.

title: Indonesia proposes 3 measures to meet MSCI's transparency demands
summary: As part of their eight-point plan, Indonesian authorities have come up with three proposed measures to meet MSCI's transparency demands and avoid potential downgrading to emerging market status.

title: Thomas Djiwandono sworn in as BI deputy governor
summary: The former deputy finance minister, who also President Prabowo Subianto's nephew, replaced Juda Agung, who resigned as BI deputy governor on Jan. 13 and was inaugurated as deputy finance minister on Thursday.

title: Danantara breaks ground on $7b downstream industry projects
summary: The projects, launched simultaneously across 13 regions on Friday, are fully funded from Danantara’s internal resources and are expected to create about 6,000 direct jobs, the fund said in a statement.

title: Japan's Takaichi may struggle to soothe voters and markets
summary: Japanese stocks soared to record highs Monday after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's election triumph, but experts warned that the country's first woman leader could struggle to keep both voters and markets happy.

title: Asian markets rally as Japan shares surge to record peak
summary: Nikkei jumped 4.2 percent to all-time highs as the government's decisive majority after the election clears the way for more spending and tax cuts.

title: Crackdown on mining permits faces legal scrutiny
summary: A potential lawsuit over halted mining operations could expose the state to fiscal risks reaching tens of trillions of rupiah, extending far beyond legal fees to include lost revenue and compensation claims.

title: Danantara steps in as primary funder for new Krakatau Steel plant
summary: Danantara has stepped up to fill the funding gap for a new Krakatau Steel facility at KIEC, which previously attracted interest from Chinese investors.

title: EU tells TikTok to change 'addictive' design
summary: The EU said Friday that TikTok needs to change its "addictive design" or risk heavy fines under the bloc's digital content rules, drawing a sharp pushback from the Chinese-owned platform.

title: Crypto firm accidentally sends $40 billion in bitcoin to users
summary: According to local reports, Bithumb was meant to send about 2,000 won (US$1.37) to each customer as part of a promotion, but mistakenly transferred roughly 2,000 bitcoins per user.

title: Unemployment figure subsides despite growing layoffs
summary: Data from the Manpower Ministry in January showed a 13 percent layoff increase in 2025 compared with the preceding year.

title: Economic fundamentals solid, govt insists, after Moody’s lowered outlook
summary: Economists interpret the rating agency’s latest assessment as a serious corrective signal, noting that a downgrade in Indonesia’s credit rating could sharply raise borrowing costs and pile pressure on the rupiah.

title: Ex-BI deputy replaces Tommy as deputy finance minister
summary: In what appears to be a coordinated role swap, the President has appointed a former BI deputy governor to fill the deputy finance minister post left vacant by his nephew Tommy Djiwandono, who is set to take up his new job as BI deputy governor.

title: Indonesian markets slide again after Moody's cuts outlook
summary: The benchmark Jakarta Composite Index lost 2.5 percent while the rupiah dropped as much as 0.37 percent to 16,888 per dollar, its lowest since January 22 and down 1 percent for the year.
